results.title: Tasmania's south west: a wilderness in question
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rolf De Heer and Damon Smith
results.brief_description: Designed to increase public awareness of the nature of the South West Tasmanian wilderness and the threats facing it. Concentrates on the two main threats, namely the Hydro-Electric Commission’s damming and flooding of the wild rivers of the area for power development purposes and the extensive logging of the native forests by the Forestry Commission. Explores the issues at hand by interviews with leading figures on both sides of the struggle. Narrated by Ian McGarrity.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Kay Roberts
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about still water swimming [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Peter Lake
results.brief_description: At a family picnic by a river, a father explains to his young son the dangers of swimming in still water. The film then shows the rescue methods relevant to swimming pools, rivers and calm beaches. Note: In Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about driving [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Kay Roberts
results.brief_description: Shows various driving conditions that may be encountered in Australia. The demands of both city and country driving are dealt with. Different traffic regulations in each state are explained, with an emphasis on the need to obey traffic signs and laws. Shows how to set about buying a car. Note: In Italian.

results.title: As long as I can walk
results.brief_description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.

results.title: The City of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Roger Climpson narrates this concise and interesting film on Melbourne. A brief history is outlined at the beginning noting some of the key figures who moved Melbourne from a settlement to a city, including John Batman and John Fawker. An incredible amount of material is fitted into the film’s short duration, including the outer central business locations like Albert Park, Flemington, St Kilda and Northland Shopping Centre, Preston. The newer multi-story buildings in the city are attractively shot. Opening shot of the infamous (now demolished) Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria building in its early stages of construction. Also includes footage of the Robin Boyd Southgate fountain sculpture in Snowden Gardens.

results.title: [Melbourne buildings]
results.brief_description: A compilation of short segments highlighting various Melbourne buildings. ‘Elizabeth Tower Motel’ showcasing the cantelever staircase; construction of the new ‘Allan’s Music’ building; a modern office building; Parliament House; St Vincent’s Hospital; demolition of a building on an unidentified site; footage of the intersection of Flinders and Swanston streets taken from Southbank showing the Federation Square site and surrounds before the Gas and Fuel towers were constructed and demolished; ornamental gates near St Paul’s Cathedral; ANZ Bank.

results.title: The Tempest in Bali
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Ugo Mariotti and Barbara Mariotti
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In 1988 a group of students from Murdoch University under the leadership of David George and Serge Tampalini staged a production of Shakespeare’s “The Tempest” in Bali during the monsoon. The program documents the various bureaucratic problems they encountered and the assimilation of Balinese dance, music and shadow puppets into the production.

results.title: Errol Flynn
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Ron Saunders, Pamela Vanneck and Michael Carson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Errol Flynn’s natural charm and good looks saw him become a screen legend as Hollywood’s greatest swashbuckling lover and matinee idol. This film takes an irreverent look at the nineteen year old Flynn’s escapades in Sydney as he sets off on the path to notoriety.

results.title: [Remix: Transport]
results.brief_description: This short film is a remix of archival footage from the ACMI Collection, focusing on public transport in Victoria. The remix contains footage of trams, trains, Flinders Street Station and city streets in Melbourne.
